directory.title: About 18 million acres of forest are lost to deforestation each year.
Fossil fuels are expected to supply almost [EQ] of world energy use through 2040.
Solar power, wind power and other renewable energy sources are helping to lessen the dependency on oil and fossil fuels.
Sabine entered a division expression into her calculator. The quotient is shown on the calculator screen. What expression could Sabine have entered?
Write Decimals with Multiple Repeating Digits as Fractions
Because repeating decimals are rational numbers, you can write them in fraction form.

Classify Numbers as Rational or Irrational
Numbers that are not rational are called irrational numbers.
Determine whether the following numbers are rational or irrational. 8.NS.1.1
Compare [EQ] and 5.51326... . Plot each number at its approximate location on a number line.
Compare and Order Rational and Irrational Numbers
To compare rational and irrational numbers, you must first find rational approximations of the irrational numbers. You can approximate irrational numbers using perfect squares or by rounding.
Evaluate Square Roots and Cube Roots
Evaluate Cube Roots to Solve Problems
Convince Me! How can you find the cube root of 64?
Evaluate Perfect Squares and Perfect Cubes
Evaluate Square Roots to Solve Problems
The cube root of a number is a number whose cube is equal to that number.
The square root of a number is a number whose square is equal to that number.
Using Square Roots and Cube Roots
Kyle has a large, cube-shaped terrarium for his iguana. He wants to cover the opening with a square screen. What are the dimensions, [EQ] for the screen?
Solve Equations Involving Imperfect Squares and Cubes
You can use square roots to solve equations involving squares.
You can use cube roots to solve equations involving cubes.
The Traverses are adding a new room to their house. The room will be a cube with a volume of 6,859 cubic feet. They are going to put in hardwood floors, which costs $10 per square foot. How much w...
While packing for their cross-country move, the Chen family uses a crate that has the shape of a cube. 8.EE.1.2
If the crate has the volume [EQ] cubic feet, what is the length of one edge?
The Chens want to pack a large, framed painting. If the framed painting has the shape of a square with an area of 12 square feet, will the painting fit flat against a side of the crate? Explain.
How well did you do on the mid-topic checkpoint? Fill in the stars.
Six members of the math club are forming two teams for a contest. The teams will be determined by having each student draw a number from a box.
The table shows the results of the draw. The students who drew rational numbers will form the team called the Tigers. The students who drew irrational numbers will form the team called the Lions.
List the members of each team.
The student on each team who drew the greatest number will be the captain of that team. Who will be the captain of the Tigers? Show your work.
Who will be the captain of the Lions? Show your work.

B. What conclusion can you make about the relationship between the number of sit-ups in each set?

Use Powers of 10 to Estimate Quantities
A. How might Jeff have determined his estimate? How might Keegan have determined his estimate?
B. Whose estimate, Jeff's or Keegan's, is more logical? Explain.
Matthias used a laser to measure the average thickness of a human hair. A sheet of paper is about 0.0013 meter thick. How do the two thicknesses compare?
Find How Many Times as Much
You can estimate a very large or very small number by rounding the number to its greatest place value, and then writing that number as a single digit times a power of 10.
Use Structure How can you use your knowledge of powers of 10 to rewrite the number?
Write Large Numbers in Scientific Notation
Convince Me! Why do very large numbers have positive exponents when written in scientific notation? Explain.
Write Small Numbers in Scientific Notation
The width of the red blood cell, expressed in scientific notation, is [EQ] meter.
Convert Scientific Notation to Standard Form
Use Appropriate Tools Certain calculators may display scientific notation using the symbol EE or E. The number that follows is the power of 10.
Scientific notation is a way to write very large numbers or very small numbers. Scientists use scientific notation as a more efficient and convenient way of writing such numbers.
To write a number in scientific notation in standard form, multiply the decimal number by the power of 10.
1. After watching the video, what is the first question that comes to mind?
2. Write the Main Question you will answer.
3. Construct Arguments Predict an answer to this Main Question. Explain your prediction.
4. On the number line below, write a number that is too small to be the answer. Write a number that is too large.
5. Plot your prediction on the same number line.

MAFS.8.EE.1.1 Know and apply the properties of integer exponents to generate equivalent numerical expressions. Also 8.EE.1.3
6. What information in this situation would be helpful to know? How would you use that information?
7. Use Appropriate Tools What tools can you use to get the information you need? Record the information as you find it.
8. Model with Math Represent the situation using the mathematical content, concepts, and skills from this topic. Use your representation to answer the Main Question.
9. What is your answer to the Main Question? Is it greater or less than your prediction? Explain why.
10. Write the answer you saw in the video.
11. Reasoning Does your answer match the answer in the video? If not, what are some reasons that would explain the difference?
12. Make Sense and Persevere Would you change your model now that you know the answer? Explain.
13. Model with Math Explain how you used a mathematical model to represent the situation. How did the model help you answer the Main Question?
14. Generalize What pattern did you notice in your calculations? How did that pattern help you solve the problem?
15. Use Structure How many times does a heart beat in a lifetime? Use your solution to the Main Question to help you solve.

Operations with very large or very small numbers can be carried out more efficiently using scientific notation. The properties of exponents apply when carrying out operations.

What are real numbers? How are real numbers used to solve problems?
Draw lines to connect each vocabulary word with its definition.
a number that cannot be written in the form [EQ] , where [EQ] and [EQ] are integers and [EQ]
a way to express a number as the product of two factors, one greater than or equal to 1 and less than 10, and the other a power of 10
a number that when multiplied by itself equals the original number
a number whose cube equals the original number
To multiply two powers with the same base, keep the common base and add the exponents.
To multiply two powers with the same exponent and different bases, multiply the bases and keep the exponent.
a number that is the square of an integer
When you have an exponent raised to a power, keep the base and multiply the exponents.
Use vocabulary words to explain how to find the length of each side of a square garden with an area of 196 square inches.

You can write repeating decimals in fraction form by writing two equations. You multiply each side of one equation by a power of 10. Then you subtract the equations to eliminate the repeating decimal.
Write each number as a fraction or a mixed number.
An irrational number is a number that cannot be written in the form [EQ] , where [EQ] and [EQ] are integers and [EQ] . Rational and irrational numbers together make up the real number system.
The number [EQ] is irrational because 50 is not the square of any integer.

2. Classify [EQ] as rational or irrational. Explain.

LESSON 1-4 Evaluate Square Roots and Cube Roots

Remember that a perfect square is the square of an integer. A square root of a number is a number that when multiplied by itself is equal to the original number. Similarly, a perfect cube is the cube ...
A monument has a cube shape with a volume of 729 cubic meters. What is the length of each edge of the monument?
So, the length of each edge is 9 meters.
Classify each number as a perfect square, a perfect cube, both, or neither.
5. A gift box is a cube with a volume of 512 cubic inches. What is the length of each edge of the box?
LESSON 1-5 Solve Equations Using Square Roots and Cube Roots

You can use square roots to solve equations involving squares. You can use cube roots to solve equations involving cubes. Equations with square roots often have two solutions. Look at the context to s...
Mattie wants to build a square deck to make a kiddie play area of 144 square feet. What will be the length of each side of the deck?
Use the formula [EQ] to find each side length.
Length cannot be negative, so the length of each side of the deck will be 12 feet.
5. A container has a cube shape. It has a volume of 216 cubic inches. What are the dimensions of one face of the container?
LESSON 1-6 Use Properties of Integer Exponents
These properties can help you write equivalent expressions that contain exponents.
Use the properties of exponents to write an equivalent expression for each given expression.

The Zero Exponent Property states that any nonzero number raised to the power of 0 is equal to 1. The Negative Exponent Property states that for any nonzero rational number [EQ] and integer [EQ] , [EQ...
Write each expression using positive exponents.
LESSON 1-8 Use Powers of 10 to Estimate Quantities
You can estimate very large and very small quantities by writing the number as a single digit times a power of 10.
Keisha is about 1,823,933 minutes old. Write this age as a single digit times a power of 10.
First round to the greatest place value. 1,823,933 is about 2,000,000.
Write the rounded number as a single digit times a power of 10.
1. In the year 2013 the population of California was about 38,332,521 people. Write the estimated population as a single digit times a power of 10.
2. The wavelength of green light is about 0.00000051 meter. What is this estimated wavelength as a single digit times a power of 10?

3. The land area of Connecticut is about 12,549,000,000 square meters. The land area of Rhode Island is about 2,707,000,000 square meters. How many times greater is the land area of Connecticut than t...
A number in scientific notation is written as a product of two factors, one greater than or equal to 1 and less than 10, and the other a power of 10.
First, place the decimal point to the right of the first nonzero digit.
Then, count the number of digits to the right of the decimal point to determine the power of 10. 65,700,000 in scientific notation is [EQ] .
4. The radius of a hydrogen atom is 0.000000000025 meter. How would you express this radius in scientific notation?
LESSON 1-10 Operations with Numbers in Scientific Notation

When multiplying and dividing numbers in scientific notation, multiply or divide the first factors. Then multiply or divide the powers of 10. When adding and subtracting numbers in scientific notation...
If the decimal part of the result is not greater than or equal to 1 and less than 10, move the decimal point and adjust the exponent.
Perform each operation. Express your answers in scientific notation.
4. The population of Town A is [EQ] people. The population of Town B is [EQ] people. How many times greater is the population of Town A than the population of Town B?
